content: What famous American inventor, known for his work with electricity and the invention of the phonograph, has a nickname that means "The Wizard of Menlo Park"?

I think I know who you're talking about. Is it Thomas Edison? He's famous for inventing the phonograph and making improvements to the electric light bulb. I've heard that he was called "The Wizard of Menlo Park" because of all the innovative work he did there. Is that the right person?
